Field Detail

frame

static ProgramWindow frame
Program frame

partitionMap

private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> partitionMap
This arraylist maps partition identifiers to an integer index. It does this by constructing a list of partition ID's as well as a number - the number they are associated with at creation. It then appends these 2 values, thus the partition integer ID can be obtained by parsing the last character in the concatenated String.

partitionTrees

private static DirectoryTree[] partitionTrees
A tree is constructed for every available partition on the user's filesystem. The summary of total disk usage is constructed from the concatenation of the sizes of these individual trees e.g A user has 2 partitions, C: and D:, with sizes 150gb and 200gb respectively. The program constructs 2 trees for these partitions. with the summary consisting of a pie-graph with 2 slices, C: (43%) and D: (57%)

getAvailableSystemPartitions

private java.io.File[] getAvailableSystemPartitions()
Returns a list of available partitions on this system. Does not return partitions that have size 0

public static DirectoryTree getTree(int index)

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

scan

public void scan(int index)
Starts scanning the drive corresponding to the DirectoryTree at the specified index. If the index is -1, every partition will be scanned in order to create the overview

Parameters:
index -

stopScan

public static void stopScan(int index)
Checks to see if there is a DirectoryTree scan underway. If there is a scan the thread created in the scan method above is halted and the frame is notified of the cancellation.

Parameters:
index -
